'''Fortinbras Took I''' was the twenty-fifth [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Fortinbras was the son of [[Ferumbras Took II|Ferumbras II]]. He inherited the Thainship upon his father's death in {{SR|1201}}, and passed it on to his son [[Gerontius Took|Gerontius]] after his death.<ref>{{App|Took}}</ref>

==Etymology==
[[wikipedia:Fortinbras|Fortinbras]] is the name of two characters in Shakespeare's ''[[wikipedia:Hamlet|Hamlet]]''. It is French for "strong in arms".<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>
